title: Banks with API's

title: Changes to this Site
synopsis: Below we list recent changes to this site only without also listing changes from the [[Neighbourhood]]:

title: DAO
synopsis: A DAO or [[decentralized autonomous organization]], is an [[algorithmic entity]] that acts in the world much as a legal entity acts, except that it is able to do so without the normal constraints of law, but rather simply by the way the code manages incentives and decisions (cryptocurrencies and votes for instance).

title: Ethereum
synopsis: Ethereum is an open-source, public, blockchain-based distributed computing platform featuring smart contract (scripting) functionality. It provides a decentralized Turing-complete virtual machine, the Ethereum Virtual Machine ([[EVM]]), which can execute scripts using an international network of public nodes.

title: Fedwiki Tools
synopsis: Here we list a few tools that are of particular use in managing and creating [[Fedwiki]] content.

title: Finance
synopsis: There is a great deal of innovation in finance that is currently underway, both in terms of distributed ledger or blockchain technology and in the social and governance underpinnings for how we deal with such these forms of finance.

title: OneClickOrgs
synopsis: One Click Orgs is a social enterprise based in London that provides a range of innovative platforms for democratic membership organisations - [http://www.oneclickorgs.com/ oneclickorgs.com]

title: Open banking
synopsis: __Open Banking__ is a [[financial services]] term as part of [[financial technology]] that refers to the Open Banking Working Group (OBWG) - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Open_banking wikipedia]

title: People Powered Money
synopsis: People Powered Money is a forthcoming conference that we will be running at various locations around the world on financial systems that are currently operating, or in the process of being created that offer an alternative to mainstream economic thinking.

title: Ricardian contract
synopsis: The Ricardian contract is a method of recording a document as a contract at law, and linking it securely to other systems, such as accounting, for the contract as an issuance of value. It is robust through use of identification by cryptographic hash function, transparent through use of readable text for legal prose and efficient through markup language to extract essential information - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ricardian_contract wikipedia]

title: Ricardian vs Smart Contract
synopsis: [[Smart contract]]s are an abstract concept relating to the automated performance of an already agreed contract, whereas the [[Ricardian contract]] is a design pattern to capture the intent of the agreement of the parties, before its performance - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ricardian_contract#Relationship_to_Smart_Contracts wikipedia]

title: Ripple
synopsis: The [[Ripple (payment protocol)]] is a trust-less transfer technology based on a network of servers that enables trading in different currencies. It is released under the [[ISC license]] - [https://ripple.com/ ripple.com]

title: Ripple (payment protocol)
synopsis: Ripple is a real-time gross settlement system (RTGS), currency exchange and remittance network by Ripple. Also called the Ripple Transaction Protocol (RTXP) or Ripple protocol, it is built upon a distributed open source Internet protocol, consensus ledger and native cryptocurrency called XRP (ripples) - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ripple_(payment_protocol) wikipedia]

title: TrustLines
synopsis: The Trustlines Network is the original [[Ripple (payment protocol)]] built on [[Ethereum]]. It looks like an interesting and solid basis for building a [[Creative Currency]] - [https://trustlines.network/ trustlines.network]

title: Welcome Visitors
synopsis: Here we gather notes and research regarding [[finance]], [[fintech]], and different forms of money.

title: Research Group Activity
synopsis: Here we list views of the activity of groups and individual related to the current project. You may want to keep an eye on:

title: Open Banking Nigeria
synopsis: __Open Banking Nigeria__ is an [[Open Banking]] initiative created as non-partisan and non-financial API standards for [[Nigerian]] [[financial services]] - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Open_Banking_Nigeria wikipedia]

title: Starling Bank
synopsis: Everything you need to know about Starling Bank - Who we are, what we do, how we can help you and any other questions you may have- [https://www.starlingbank.com/faq/ starlingbank.com]
